pullRequest.title: Addition: Bee Armor
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description

I have created Bee Armor, basically the honey equivalent of the Slime Armor.
Because bees fly I also replaced the chestplate with an Elytra (I was really debating whether to put it in the "Magical Gadgets" tab but it Probably wouldn't be obvious that it was a part of the bee set)
I also added some features to the armor to make life easier for those players playing on high latency servers, taking off is much easier and landing (because of the slow fall effect) is a piece of cake, the boots are also fall damage resistant and give you a jump boost (at that point i realized the similarity's are a bit to much so i stopped there with features)
Also the ballance may need to be tweaked a bit, i havent tested this extencively in survival yet.
Side note: I'm relatively new to coding so if I messed something up in a major way please go easy on me.
Changes

Added BeeWingListener which is responsible for the slow falling effect given to the player when nearing the ground.
Added the Bee Boots to the SlimefunBootsListener to make them negate damage and play a the "Honey Fall" sound effect when they "absorb" the damage.
Added the armor to the ReserchSetup, SlimefunItemSetup and SlimefunItems
Related Issues


N/A
Checklist



 I have fully tested the proposed changes and promise that they will not break everything into chaos.
 I have also tested the proposed changes in combination with various popular addons and can confirm my changes do not break them.
 I followed the existing code standards and didn't mess up the formatting.
 I did my best to add documentation to any public classes or methods I added.

commit.message: Added Bee Armor (and all the things to make it function)
Fixed some Wildcards (Auto formater messed with it)

nodes.bodyText: Using the PlayerMoveEvent is very risky as it can cause a ton of lag.
Exclusion checks like these should be at the top for performance reasons.
Bees/Honey blocks have only been introduced in 1.15. Slimefun however is for 1.13, 1.14 and 1.15. So you will need to do adequate checks to make these version-exclusive...
Bees/Honey blocks have only been introduced in 1.15. Slimefun however is for 1.13, 1.14 and 1.15. So you will need to do adequate checks to make these version-exclusive...

nodes.bodyText: Bees/Honey blocks have only been introduced in 1.15. Slimefun however is for 1.13, 1.14 and 1.15. So you will need to do adequate checks to make these version-exclusive...
You added a new research but didnt update the language files...

This is ran on every little movement, it can run hundreds or thousands of times a second. Doing an item lookup EACH time is gonna REALLY hurt performance. You should do a ton of checks before ANYTHING to make sure this is exactly what you want!
You should use the heightmaps (getHighestBlockAt, getHighestBlockYAt) which would be much more efficient.
Should probably just revert all this. It makes no real change but now imports are quite unorganised
Also you shouldn't ignore cancelled. There's really no point.

commit.message: Fixed Mincraft Version Compatibility and some IDE weirdness

nodes.bodyText: These items actually don't use any 1.15 Materials, so there isn't really much of a point in initializing them conditionally here. It's fine for these items to exist on 1.13/1.14 since you already handle that in SlimefunItemSetup
Please do not use wildcard imports.

commit.message: Added the research text to the researches_en Language file

nodes.bodyText: Aside from all of the above issues that are still waiting, this is also still missing an entry for your new research. There are no file changes.

commit.message: Changed some stuff in BeeWingListener, Should be more performance friendly now.
Some refactoring and added a material check.

nodes.bodyText: } and else on seperate lines please.

I was gonna point out the irresponsibly chosen name, should have rather been "beeArmorEnchantments".
But then I realized the above armorsets use the exact same pattern ._.

This check is pretty redundant since the material check is one of the first lines in SlimefunUtils.isItemSimilar anyway. So this adds no real benefit to it, neither readability, efficiency nor performance.
Wrong indentation
Also since we now enforce these: Nonnull please
@LinoxGH You can pretty much add yourself as an author here below too at this point.
Nonnull and documentation please.
This should rather be an int since you only decrement by whole numbers anyway
Not really any need for this distance variable here, it is a bit redundant. You can just return y - (the new loc y)

commit.message: Refactoring, requested changes and lots of improvement.
